background_description: The background consists of several natural, weathered rocks and pebbles of varying sizes and shapes. The rocks are predominantly grey and brownish-grey, with visible textures, specks of darker minerals, and some smoother surfaces mixed with coarser, granular ones. The lighting creates natural shadows and highlights across the rocky terrain.
camouflage_type: Color blending / Pattern matching / Shape disruption
explanation: The spider exhibits strong camouflage against the rocky background. Its body color, a blend of dark grey and brownish-grey, closely matches the dominant tones and darker mineral speckles present on the surrounding rocks. The textured appearance of its body also aligns well with the rough, granular surfaces of the stones. The egg sac it carries, being a lighter off-white/cream color, blends effectively with the lighter patches and highlights on some of the rocks. The spider's irregular shape and splayed legs, combined with its coloration, also contribute to shape disruption, making it harder to distinguish from the uneven rock contours. Overall, there is low contrast between the spider and its immediate environment, making it blend in exceptionally well.
